page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY (1)
page.content: Mentioned must be made of the{GOSPEL {OAK}in Hampage Wood. This wood is approached by a number of well sign-posted bridleways - a pleasant change from where footpaths have been obliterated by farmers! Hampage Wood was where much of the timber was obtained for the building of Winchester Cathedral in 1079. According to the "{Victoria County {History" } "Bishop Walkelin ...asked William the Conqueror for the gift of as much timber as he could carry away from Hampage Wood in four days ans nights. the King consented,and the bishop,having collected all the woodmen from the surrounding country, managed to clear the wood with the exception of one tree under which St.Augustine was said to have preached."
